description: A plant-based "tuna" salad that tastes and feels like the real thing.
name: JACKFRUIT TUNA-LESS SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 14 oz [440 g] can of young jackfruit (we order it on Amazon.com)
1 small red onion 1/4 cup (38 g, finely chopped)
1 heaping tbsp. (3 g fresh chopped parsley leaves)
2 tablespoon 30 g unsweetened plain plant-based yogurt (I used Kite Hill almond)
Ground sea salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Drain and rinse the jackfruit and pulse in a food processor until it’s shredded and resembles canned tuna. If you don’t have a food processor you can chop it with a knife.
Put the jackfruit in a medium mixing bowl and add the celery, onion, parsley mustard, yogurt, paprika, and salt and pepper and stir until it’s fully combined.
Serve as is or as a sandwich.
